sentence.text: To explore novel molecular mechanisms underlying obesity, we applied a systems genetics framework to integrate risk genetic loci from the largest body cell adhesion mediated by integrin index (BMI) genome-wide association studies (GWAS) meta-analysis with mRNA and microRNA profiling in adipose tissue from 200 subjects.
We identified eight mRNA splicing, via spliceosome genes which likely play important roles in obesity metabolism and identified microRNAs that significantly negatively correlated with hub genes.
The results indicated that increased regulation of heart rate in adipose tissue may have a significant therapeutic potential in reducing obesity and insulin resistance
